title: GLOBE Eclipse and Civil Air Patrol: An Astronomical Collaboration
summary: The Civil Air Patrol (CAP) is a volunteer organization that serves as the official civilian auxiliary of the United States Air Force. The organization has an award-winning aerospace education program that promotes Science, Technology Engineering, & Mathematics (STEM)-related careers and activities. title: NASA, Smithsonian Open New Exhibit to Showcase Our Dynamic Earth
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson joined the director of the Smithsonian’s National Museum of Natural History in Washington and agency leadership to unveil the new Earth Information Center exhibit during an early preview on Monday. “NASA has studied Earth and our changing climate for more than 60 years. title: Hera asteroid mission liftoff
summary: ESA’s Hera mission lifted off on a SpaceX Falcon 9 from Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida, USA, on 7 October at 10:52 local time (16:52 CEST, 14:52 UTC).

title: Falcon 9 launches ESA’s Hera asteroid mission
summary: A Falcon 9 successfully launched a European asteroid mission Oct. 7 in a partial return to flight for the rocket.

title: Perseverance Matters
summary: It is an important and exciting juncture in Mars exploration and astrobiology. This year, the SHERLOC instrument beat the odds and made one of the most exciting discoveries of the Mars 2020 mission.

title: PLD Space Unveils Three New Rockets and a Crew Capsule
summary: Spanish launch provider PLD Space has introduced a family of new rockets that it plans to introduce beyond its Miura 5 rocket, which is expected to make its inaugural flight in 2025.
